lesson_title: Re-Engaging with Common Factors and Multiples
lesson_description: Reinforce learning by connecting classroom instruction to individual problem solving and practice. MATHia serves as the primary instructional tool in these lessons.
learning_goals: I can work independently on my MATHia playlist and engage in activities to support my individual learning goals.

lesson_structure_and_pacing_guide.title: Time to Factorize!
lesson_structure_and_pacing_guide.description: Students analyze two strategies for identifying the prime factors of a number.

lesson_structure_and_pacing_guide.title: Personalized Learning and Intervention
lesson_structure_and_pacing_guide.description:
### MATHia Playlist

#### Using the Distributive Property with Numeric Expressions
Students apply distributive properties (multiplication over addition, division over addition) to rewrite numeric expressions and calculate efficiently.

#### Determining the LCM or GCF of Two Numbers
Students use factor trees to determine the LCM or GCF of two numbers by identifying and multiplying shared and non-shared prime factors.

### Clarify

#### Center A: MATHstream Interactive Video
Students complete the Least Common Multiple MATHstream interactive video to revisit strategies for determining the least common multiple of two numbers less than or equal to 12.

### Re-Teach

#### Center B: MATHstream Interactive Video
Students complete a MATHstream video based on the instruction they missed.
• Lesson 3 Searching for Common Ground
